chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian Eugene King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adrian Eugene King is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adrian Eugene King was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today August 13, 2019 by 2:30 pm.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.
Court will reserve on sentence credit at this time.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA: Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Adrian Eugene King appeared from jail. Case called at 11:21 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a plea hearing. Atty Harrelson states DE requested a plea hearing right away so was set for today. Did not have time to complete a plea questionnaire with DE. ADA Kelly recites agreement. State is in compliance with Victims rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent in 15CF286. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent in 15CF286. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct's 2 and 3 in 15CF286. Sentencing arguments. Atty Harrelson requesting additional time to submit pre sentence jail credit. DE makes statement. 20 days to appeal. Court will reserve on pre sentence credit at this time. 

Crt orders:
- S/W 3 years probation. May be transferred to Minnesota. Report to probation by 2:30 p.m. today August 13, 2019. Bond will continue until reports to probation.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- Court costs of $268.00. Payable over the course of probation to DOC

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $250.00

- No Contact with Jamie S.

- Comply with any and all mental health and AODA recommendations

- Take medications as prescribed.
To RMW from DE requesting a speedy plea date. FILE per RMW. hml

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jamie S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Jamie S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL for RMW, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Francis D. Collins,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Adrian Eugene King appeared from jail.   Includes 15CF286, 95TR4081 & 95TR4082. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Prelim demanded. State is asking for $1000.00 CB, Atty Kucinski argues. Defendant has court in MPLS next week for disability.  Waive speedy prelim. Defendant is unable to pay for the citations. Defendant meet with the payment clerk on 95TR4081 & 95TR4082 and pay some on 8/3/15.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
